title: Wrangell - St Elias National Park & Preserve: Backcountry Area & Cabins
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Backcountry Area & Cabins             Backcountry Area and Cabins          Most of the park is backcountry where visitor services are very few. Click on the map for a larger image.        Backcountry Area and Cabins Wrangell-St. Elias is mostly backcountry. It includes the Nutzotin, St. Elias, and Chugach Mountains; the high peaks of the Wrangell Mountains; and the Chitina, Chisana, and White Rivers and their tributaries. Visitor services include backcountry cabins and some lodges, but very little else. This is a place where a "primitive type of recreation" is experienced. Follow the below links to discover how to safely visit it:         Plan Your Visit  Backcountry Cabins Backcountry Lodging Backcountry Safety Backcountry FAQs   Things To Do  Backpacking Mountaineering River Trips Flying Outfitters and Guides   Natural Features  Chugach Mountains Mt. St. Elias Mt. Bona and Mt. Churchill Bagley Icefield Chitina River White River Teabay Lakes   Culture  Chisana Historic Mining Landscape Bremner Historic Mining District
